title: SWAGGER LIKE US
details:
We're back for another incredible season on the beautiful patio of El Rio!
About this event
Swagger Like Us Presents
Sunday May 1st, 3-8p
El Rio, 3158 Mission Street
Live Performance: Freddie
Host: Sir JoQ
DJs: Infinite Jess, Juanny Depp, Guerrilla Pump
Photos by: Takeover Tokyo
Follow: IG @swaggerlikeussf; swaggersf.com
Swagger Like Us acknowledge the Traditional Custodians of the land on which we gather, and recognise their continuing connection to land, water and community. We acknowledge our event is being held on the traditional lands of the Muwekma Ohlone people. We pay our respect to elders past and present.

title: The Chisel ++ Spiritual Cramp ++ Fatigue ++ Ultra Sect
details:
The Chisel, Spiritual Cramp, Fatigue, Ultra Sect at El Rio SF
The Chisel ('huge, stompy, singalong-heavy form of punk rock' feat. Chubby from Chubby & The Gang on guitar) + very special guests!
About this event
Talent Moat and YOFC present: The Chisel, Spiritual Cramp, Fatigue, Ultra Sect + YOFC deejays at El Rio SF. Wed.., 5/11. 7:00pm doors, $15 adv. 21+.
London band The Chisel‚Äôs new EP, ‚ÄòCome See Me / Not The Only One‚Äô embodies a variety of British punk traditions, brought on by each member‚Äôs distinct origin story; Blackpool, Croydon, Acton, Chingford, and Guildford all enter the equation of the group‚Äôs ancestry. Their heterogeneous background contributes to what Stereogum called a ‚Äòhuge, stompy, singalong-heavy form of punk rock'. Featuring Chubby from Chubby & The Gang on guitar and Johan Falco of Fucked Up behind recording, their latest release certainly garnered them their punk credentials.
"San Francisco‚Äôs Spiritual Cramp make nervous, urgent, wiry punk rock, and they‚Äôre extremely good at it." - Stereogum
Fatigue "Take the ugly snarl and familiarity of first wave punk, add the blood-thirsty fervor and frostbite of a vacant Crass Corridor warehouse in 1982, and steady it with the gobbing, No-Future confidence of the UK punk sound of that same year, and you end up with a snarling beast similar to this."
Ultra Sect Oi! band from the San Francisco Bay Area
PURCHASE TICKETS

title: FIESTA FLAMENCA! ($10)
details:
Join us for a passionate evening of flamenco dance and music in the authentic style of the tablaos of Spain.
Experience an intimate live performance with dancers, guitarists and singers from the vibrant Bay Area flamenco community, and an open floor for all aficionados to dance sevillanas and bulerias!
FEATURING:
Guest Dancer: Carola Zertuche
Vocals: Roberto Zamora
Guitar: Roberto Aguilar
Fiesta Flamenca Cuadro Dancers: Sara Moncada, Claudia Deveze and Mimi Wiener Mishor

title: ADELANTE - A Fundraiser for Brown Amy ‚ù§Ô∏è
details:
"On August 4th 2022 I‚Äôm going to be getting top surgery.
It has definitely been a whole ass journey (lol) from navigating a broken healthcare system, to feeling peoples discomfort when I naively tell them with so much excitement about my process. While simultaneously feeling extreme amounts of gratitude and happiness that I finally get to feel good in my body.
I‚Äôve been hella in my feelings through this process lol, and have had to be more vulnerable then what I‚Äôm comfortable with but I guess I‚Äôm starting to see this as strength + growth and that my days of seeing vulnerability as weakness are more and more behind me.
Thank you to @devoncito @madmarie13 & @flavia_elisa_mora for helping me realize that I don‚Äôt have to figure this out on my own and that I could ask for support from my community. So if you can, please come thru next Thursday 5/12 @elriosf and celebrate with me and some of my favorite djs NO ONE TURNED AWAY FOR LACK OF FUNDS so come as you are and we will welcome you with open armsüåπü§é"

title: SHE OUT HERE: Los Pendejxs ++ Mayy Castleman ++ Tropical City ++ Galore ++ Siri Seiko ++ VENDORS & FOOD!
DAYTIME REALNESS!!! GAY TO BREAKERS :)
The City Surf Project Presents: SURF SHORTS & Live Tunes by KAI LYONS ($20 Adv / $25 Door)
details:
A surf film screening fundraiser to support efforts to ensure Bay Area youth have equitable access to the ocean via surf instruction
About this event
Fellow Surfers and Friends,
We are extremely stoked to invite you to a night of short surf films, surf-inspired live music, and generally good times at El Rio, on Wednesday, May 18th in an effort to support our ongoing efforts at the City Surf Project.
Despite having some world-class breaks in Northern California, we don‚Äôt seem to get the same number of opportunities to kick back and celebrate our sport as they do in SoCal and Hawaii. In that spirit, we thought it would be cool to show some films that represent local Bay Area cinematographers and surfers.
Grab your tickets in advance for $20 or $25 at the door.
Besides production costs, all proceeds will go to the City Surf Project
Schedule for the evening:
7 - 8:30 pm - Socializing, City Surf Project team meet/greet & live surf-inspired music in El Rio's courtyard
8:30 - 9:45 pm - Screening of all short films
9:45 - 10 pm - Closing remarks and CSP Surf-a-thon announcement
About the City Surf Project
City Surf Project works to ensure equitable access to the coastline and surfing, for youth that has been historically marginalized by the sport. CSP works with schools and organizations in the Bay Area to offer year-long surf programming, where students gain life skills while connecting with the environment.
This year, CSP is hosting its fifth annual Surf-a-thon on June 18th to celebrate International Surfing Day. Participants are encouraged to raise funds for CSP‚Äôs subsidized summer surf programs. This summer CSP will go on over 50 surf outings and introduce over 100 youth to the ocean. The fundraising campaign will kick off on May 18th with a Surf Short Film Event at EL Rio. From there, folks will have a month to raise funds and fulfill their pledge at the Surf-a-thon on June 18th at Ocean Beach. Come join us so that we can share the stoke with as many youths as possible this summer.
